list_definition.definition: the (amount of) space between two straight lines or surfaces that meet

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: From his angle, I can understand why he was keen on the idea.
the angle of the two walls.

list_definition.definition: a position from which you look at something

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The photograph was taken from a rather unusual angle.

list_definition.definition: to turn or place something so that it is not straight or upright

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He angled the camera so that he could frame the scene from the side.

list_definition.definition: to present information from a particular point of view for a particular audience

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The magazine is angled towards teenage girls.

list_definition.definition: if you angle for something, you try to get something without directly asking someone for it

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He was clearly angling for a pay rise.

list_definition.definition: to use a rod and line to try to catch fish

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He spent the afternoon angling for trout.
